title: China's second earthquake in three weeks kills 4
author: Ap
text: PEKING (AP) _ An earthquake shook China near its border with the Soviet Union early today, killing four people and badly injuring about 12 others, a state seismological bureau said. It was the area's second major temblor in three weeks        The quake in China's far west Xinjiang region measured 6.8 on the Richter scale, according to the Peking-based seismological bureau. Details on the casualties were not immediately available.        The Richter scale measures ground motion as recorded on seismographs. A measurement of 7.0 is considered a major earthquake.        Zhu Lingren of the Xinjiang seismological bureau said the casualties were in Kashgar, a city of 300,000 on the ancient silk route through Central Asia.        On Aug. 23, 63 people died and 100 others were injured in a major jolt in the same area. That quake reached 7.4 on the Richter scale and left 16,000 people homeless.
